Context:
Name of the current Chancellor of George Brown College: Noella Milne
Start date of her term as George Brown College Chancellor: May 3, 2019
Previous Chancellor: Sally Horsfall Eaton
Milne's background: Immigrated to Canada from Mumbai, India, at the age of 17, worked and attended classes to earn a college diploma and university degree, then law school, and became a senior partner at Borden Ladner Gervais (BLG).
Community involvement: Volunteer and mentor, served on the Board of Governors from 2003-2009 and Foundation Board from 2010-2018, made donations to the college including a scholarship for single mothers named after her late sister, Lorna D'Souza.
Awards conferred by Milne: Degrees, diplomas, and certificates during convocation ceremonies.

Context:
Sally Horsfall Eaton served as the first Chancellor of George Brown College from an unspecified year onwards. She presided over convocation ceremonies and served as an ambassador for the college, enhancing its profile in the community. During her tenure, she ushered in new traditions for convocation, including George Brown Collegeâ€™s ceremonial mace and coat of arms. The Nursing School at George Brown College was renamed in Sally Horsfall Eaton's honour following a $4-million gift given by her and her husband, John C. Eaton. Horsfall Eaton has a long and distinguished record of volunteerism, philanthropy and public service.
